entry.title: Process Injection
entry.summary:
What is Process Injection
As described by MITRE, process injection is a method of executing arbitrary code in the address space of a separate live process. Running code in the context of another process may allow access to the processâ€™s memory, system/network resources, and possibly elevated privileges. Execution via process injection may also evade detection from security products since th...

entry.title: Windows Memory
entry.summary:
How does the Windows Memory work ?
Everybody knows what the RAM memory is, but how does it work ? In general, computer processors (CPU) are constantly making read and write operations. If this was done on the disk (SSD or HDD) constantly the computer would be very slow. That is why an intermediate place to store data was required.
Memory is a physical storage used by CPUs to store data that i...
